text: Bogan Hunters is an Australian television show. It is a comedy and also a reality television show. It is all about three people called 'Bogan Hunters' who are looking for Australia's greatest Bogan so they can give them a prize. ==Description== The show has three main actors, Pauly, Shazza and Kev the Kiwi. These three go all over Australia meeting many Bogans. They want to find one that is much more of a Bogan than any other one they meet. They have picked eight famous people to help them find who is the greatest Bogan in Australia. The greatest Bogan will get a trophy and a Holden 'Straya' ute with beer on it, or a makeover. The show is about 2 percent jokes, but the rest is all real. The show has been very popular in both Australia and New Zealand. ==Episodes== ===Series overview=== Season Episodes Originally aired iTunes release DVD release Season starts Season ends iTunes version with brand new extras Region 4 1 10 13 May 2014 15 July 2014 15 July 2014 17 July 2014 ===Season 1 (2014)=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="background:#c00; color:white;"| Number ! style="background:#c00; color:white;"| Title ! style="background:#c00; color:white;"| Director ! style="background:#c00; color:white;"| First shown on TV |} ==DVD== The DVD goes for 244 minutes. ==Characters== ===Main=== * Paul Fenech as Pauly * Elle Dawe as Shazza * Kevin Taumata as Kev the Kiwi ===Celebrity Judges=== * Angry Anderson as himself * Jonesy as himself * Amarli Inez as Miss Nude Australia * Tahir Bilgi√ß as himself * Mark "Jacko" Jackson as himself * Chris Franklin as himself * Derek Boyer as himself * Rob Shehadie as himself ===Other=== * Davey Cooper as himself * Jimmy Jackson as James * June Dally-Watkins as herself * Henry Roth as himself * Martin Miller as Marty the Engineer * Alex Romano as Jimmy ==References== ==Other websites== * Bogan Hunters, Series 1 Raw and Uncut * Official site * Facebook page Category:2010s establishments in Australia Category:2010s television series Category:2014 television series debuts Category:2014 television series endings Category:Australian television series Category:English-language television programs Category:Melbourne Category:New South Wales
